This package provides the **{GGSEG}** brain atlas for use with the [ggseg](https://ggseg.github.io/ggseg/) and [ggseg3d](https://ggseg.github.io/ggseg3d/) packages.

## Installation

Install from the ggseg [r-universe](https://ggseg.r-universe.dev/):

```{r eval = FALSE}
# Enable the ggseg universe
options(repos = c(
  ggseg = "https://ggseg.r-universe.dev",
  CRAN = "https://cloud.r-project.org"
))

install.packages("{REPO}")
```

Or install the development version from GitHub:

```{r eval = FALSE}
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("ggseg/{REPO}")
```


## Usage

### 2D Brain Plot

```{r plot-2d}
library(ggseg)
library({REPO})

ggseg(atlas = {GGSEG}) +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom",
        legend.text = element_text(size = 7)) +
  guides(fill = guide_legend(ncol = 4))
```

### 3D Brain Visualisation

```{r plot-3d-code, eval = FALSE}
library(ggseg3d)

ggseg3d(atlas = {GGSEG}) |>
  add_glassbrain() |>
  pan_camera("right lateral")
```

```{r plot-3d-render, echo = FALSE, eval = FALSE}
# This chunk generates the 3D screenshot (run manually)
library(ggseg3d)
p <- ggseg3d(atlas = {GGSEG}) |>
  add_glassbrain(hemisphere = "left") |>
  pan_camera("right lateral")
# Save screenshot
htmlwidgets::saveWidget(p, "man/figures/README-3d-plot.html")
webshot2::webshot("man/figures/README-3d-plot.html", "man/figures/README-3d-plot.png")
```

```{r show-3d, echo = FALSE, out.width = "50%", eval = file.exists("man/figures/README-3d-plot.png")}
knitr::include_graphics("man/figures/README-3d-plot.png")
```


## Atlas Details

| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| **Type** | `r {GGSEG}$type` |
| **Regions** | `r nrow({GGSEG}$data)` |
| **Hemispheres** | `r paste(unique({GGSEG}$data$hemi), collapse = ", ")` |
| **Has 2D geometry** | `r "geometry" %in% names({GGSEG}$data)` |
| **Has 3D vertices** | `r "vertices" %in% names({GGSEG}$data)` |


## Region Names

```{r regions, echo = FALSE}
regions <- unique({GGSEG}$data$region)
regions <- regions[!is.na(regions)]
cat(paste("-", sort(regions)), sep = "\n")
```
